Package io.github.jdbctemplatemapper.core

Class JdbcTemplateMapper

java.lang.Object
io.github.jdbctemplatemapper.core.JdbcTemplateMapper
public final class JdbcTemplateMapper extends Object
CRUD methods and configuration for JdbcTemplateMapper. Should be prepared in a Spring application context and given to services as bean reference. JdbcTemplateMapper caches Table meta-data and SQL. Note: An instance of JdbcTemplateMapper is thread safe once instantiated. 
 See JdbcTemplateMapper documentation 
 for more info
Author:
ajoseph

    • insert

      public void insert(Object obj)
      Inserts an object. Objects with auto increment id will have the id set to the new id from database. For non auto increment id the id has to be manually set before invoking insert(). 
       Will handle the following annotations:
 @CreatedOn property will be assigned current date and time
 @CreatedBy if IRecordOperaterrResolver is configured with JdbcTemplateMapper the property 
      will be assigned that value
 @UpdatedOn property will be assigned current date and time
 @UpdatedBy if IRecordOperaterrResolver is configured with JdbcTemplateMapper the property
                will be assigned that value
 @Version property will be set to 1. Used for optimistic locking.
      Parameters:
      obj - The object to be saved

    • update

      public Integer update(Object obj)
      Update the object. 
       Will handle the following annotations:
 @UpdatedOn property will be assigned current date and time
 @UpdatedBy if IRecordOperaterrResolver is configured with JdbcTemplateMapper the property 
                will be assigned that value
 @Version property will be incremented on a successful update. An OptimisticLockingException
                will be thrown if object is stale.
      Parameters:
      obj - object to be updated
      Returns:
      number of records updated

    • updateProperties

      public Integer updateProperties(Object obj, String... propertyNames)
      Updates the specified properties passed in as arguments. Use it when you want to update a property or a few properties of the object and not the whole object. Issues an update for only the specific properties and any auto assign properties. Comes in handy for tables with large number of columns and need to update only a few. Also you can instantiate a new Object, populate the id and just the properties needed and invoke updateProperties(). 
       Will handle the following annotations:
 @UpdatedOn property will be assigned current date and time
 @UpdatedBy if IRecordOperaterrResolver is configured with JdbcTemplateMapper the property 
                will be assigned that value
 @Version property will be incremented on a successful update. An OptimisticLockingException
                will be thrown if object is stale.
      Parameters:
      obj - object to be updated
      propertyNames - the specific property names that need to be updated.
      Returns:
      number of records updated

    • delete

      public Integer delete(Object obj)
      Deletes the object from the database.
      Parameters:
      obj - Object to be deleted
      Returns:
      number of records were deleted (1 or 0)

    • getColumnName

      public String getColumnName(Class<?> clazz, String propertyName)
      Get the column name of a property of the Model. Will return null if there is no corresponding column for the property.
      Parameters:
      clazz - the class
      propertyName - the property name
      Returns:
      the column name

    • getBeanColumnsSql

      public String getBeanColumnsSql(Class<?> clazz)
      returns a string which can be used in a sql select statement. The column alias will be the underscore case name of property name, so it works well with JdbcTemplate's BeanPropertyRowMapper

      Will return something like below if 'name' property is mapped to 'last_name': 

       "id as id, last_name as name"
      Parameters:
      clazz - the class
      Returns:
      comma separated select column string

    • loadMapping

      public void loadMapping(Class<?> clazz)
      Loads the mapping for a class. Model mappings are loaded when they are used for the first time. This method is provided so that the mappings can be loaded during Spring application startup so any mapping issues can be known at startup.
      Parameters:
      clazz - the class
